title: CC1.1.1 Conflict of Interest/Code of Ethics
snippet:
Ex Quanta Inc (d.b.a Zenlytic)
## Conflict of Interest/Code of Ethics Policy
Version: 0.0
Policy Owner: Paul Blankley
Status: Implemented
## Overview
At Zenlytic, we strive to maintain the highest levels of ethical conduct and integrity in our operations. The aim of our Conflict of Interest/Code of Ethics policy is to ensure that all personnel avoid situations where personal interests could conflict, or appear to conflict, with the interests of the company or our customers. ### 1. Purpose and Scope
The purpose of this Business Continuity Plan (BCP) is to ensure that our Business Intelligence (BI) platform can continue to operate during and after a disruptive event. This plan outlines the steps for preparedness, response, and recovery, ensuring minimal disruption to critical BI services such as data processing, reporting, and anal

title: 2025-05-21 BCP Testing Minutes
snippet:
â€¢ Simulated Incident/Scenario: The exercise simulated a catastrophic database failure requiring restoration from a backup. The main goal was to test recovery point objective (RPO) and recovery time objective (RTO).
â€¢ Participants and Roles:
â€¢ Key Discussion Points:
â€¢ Results: The team successfully walked through the full process of restoring a database from a snapshot and re-pointing the application to it. Paul confirmed that the process ensures compliance with a 5-minute RPO and a 4-hour RTO.

title: BE Candidate Screening Questions
snippet:
- What product or feature have you built from scratch that you're most proud of? 
- What product or feature have you worked on with the most demanding performance, scalability, latency, or memory requirements? Please describe these requirements.
- What is the most complex application you've ever worked on? What specific factors made it complex?
- Describe a technically challenging problem you solved that surprised you. Was it unexpectedly difficult or simple? Did you develop an elegant solution?

title: FE Candidate Screening Questions
snippet:
- How have modern AI toolsâ€”such as ChatGPT, Cursor, or othersâ€”changed your day-to-day engineering workflow? Have you built or automated anything interesting using these tools?
- Please describe the product or major feature that you are most proud of being the driving force behind.
- Imagine youâ€™ve been asked to design and build an application that helps users analyze CSV files, and you have full access to OpenAIâ€™s APIs.

title: SOC2 Background
snippet:
Zenlytic is a self-serve analytics tool that aims to simplify the process of data exploration and decision-making through its intuitive interface and powerful AI capabilities. This tool is designed to answer data-related questions in seconds, thereby reducing reliance on a time-strapped analytics team.
## Services provided

Zenlytic provides an interface for exploring and querying data, combined with dashboards for visualization and a LLM-powered chatbot named ZÃ¶e for interactive, natural langua

title: Agent core EDA structure
snippet:
As part of the new agent structure, we will be leveraging core components of Event-Driven Architecture (EDA) to increase: 
â€¢ flexibility
â€¢ adaptability
â€¢ replay-ability
# Strengths of EDA
Strengths of EDA that we want to bring to our core agent logic
â€¢ each event represents a unit of â€œfactâ€
â€¢ events are stored in event brokers (not to be confused with message brokers)
â€¢ the event broker is an append-only log
â€¢ events are produced by a producer and consumed by multiple consumers. Consumers do not

title: Business Continuity Plan
snippet:
Ex Quanta Inc (d.b.a Zenlytic)
## Human Resource Security
Version: 1.1
Policy Owner: Paul Blankley
Status: Implemented
## Testing Minutes
### 1. Purpose and Scope
The purpose of this Business Continuity Plan (BCP) is to ensure that our Business Intelligence (BI) platform can continue to operate during and after a disruptive event. This plan outlines the steps for preparedness, response, and recovery, ensuring minimal disruption to critical BI services such as data processing, reporting, and anal

title: 2025-05-21 BCP Testing Minutes
snippet:
â€¢ Simulated Incident/Scenario: The exercise simulated a catastrophic database failure requiring restoration from a backup. The main goal was to test recovery point objective (RPO) and recovery time objective (RTO).
â€¢ Participants and Roles:
â€¢ Key Discussion Points:
â€¢ Results: The team successfully walked through the full process of restoring a database from a snapshot and re-pointing the application to it. Paul confirmed that the process ensures compliance with a 5-minute RPO and a 4-hour RTO.
